title: Embassy of the United States, Juba
text:
The United States Embassy in <a href="Juba">Juba</a>, South Sudan, was first established on 9 July 2011 as the <a href="United%20States">United States</a> diplomatic mission to the country of <a href="South%20Sudan">South Sudan</a>. Upon the independence of South Sudan, the old United States Consulate General Juba, originally opened in 2005 was upgraded into a full <a href="embassy">embassy</a>, in recognition of the independence of South Sudan. The <a href="chief%20of%20mission">chief of mission</a> was <a href="Charg%C3%A9%20d%27Affaires">Chargé d'Affaires</a> <a href="R.%20Barrie%20Walkley">R. Barrie Walkley</a>, pending the appointment of an <a href="United%20States%20Ambassador%20to%20South%20Sudan">ambassador to South Sudan</a>.
On 18 October 2011 <a href="Susan%20D.%20Page">Susan D. Page</a> was confirmed as the first <a href="United%20States%20of%20America">United States</a>' Ambassador to <a href="South%20Sudan">South Sudan</a>.
